metadata.title: Week 1 Day 4: Introduction to Latin Nouns

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should be familiar with basic Latin pronunciation rules and the concept of noun cases. They have been introduced to the nominative and accusative cases, focusing on their functions as the subject and direct object in a sentence. Basic vocabulary related to family and daily activities has been covered, along with simple sentence structures. Students have practiced forming simple sentences using these cases and vocabulary.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we focused on the nominative and accusative cases, practicing with vocabulary related to family members.

primary: Understand the function of the genitive case
Identify and use genitive case endings

lesson_flow.description: Review the nominative and accusative cases with example sentences.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will recall and write example sentences on the board.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Focus on ensuring students can identify subjects and direct objects.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the genitive case and its function to show possession.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will listen and take notes on the genitive case.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use examples to show possession, like 'pater familiae'.

lesson_flow.description: Practice identifying and using the genitive case in sentences.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will work in pairs to transform sentences using the genitive case.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to assist and correct misunderstandings.

lesson_flow.description: Students complete a worksheet on the genitive case.
lesson_flow.student_action: Independently complete sentences using the genitive case.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Provide hints if students struggle, but encourage independent thinking.

lesson_flow.description: Quick quiz on nominative, accusative, and genitive cases.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will complete a short quiz.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use this to gauge understanding and plan for future lessons.

behavior.loop_behavior: Revisit concepts with new examples if confusion arises
